summary:
Washington, D.C. is the capital city of the U.S., named after George Washington. It's not a state but a federal district, created in 1790 by the U.S. Constitution. The city was designed by Pierre L'Enfant and is divided into four parts around the Capitol Building. It became the official capital in 1800 when the government moved from Philadelphia.

D.C. is home to important government buildings like the White House and is a major political center. It also has many museums and monuments, making it a popular tourist destination. The city has a unique government structure, with a mayor and council, but Congress has the final say on its laws.
title: Washington, D.C.
